titles.title: Federal Employee Student Loan Assistance Act
A bill to amend section 5379 of title 5, United States Code, to increase the annual and aggregate limits on student loan repayments by Federal agencies.
Federal Employee Student Loan Assistance Act
Federal Employee Student Loan Assistance Act
Federal Employee Student Loan Assistance Act
Federal Employee Student Loan Assistance Act

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Committee on Governmental Affairs referred to Subcommittee on Oversight of Government Management, the Federal Workforce, and the District of Columbia.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Reported by Senator Collins without amendment. With written report No. 108-109. Additional views filed.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 220.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service and Agency Organization.
Mrs. Davis, Jo Ann moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 926.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs
Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs
committee.subcommittee: Oversight of Government Management, the Federal Workforce, and the District of Columbia

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was passed by the Senate on July 30, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Federal Employee Student Loan Assistance Act - Increases the annual and aggregate limits ($10,000 and $60,000, respectively) on the amount of an employee's student loan an agency may repay.
